messages.messageBody:
Heraclitus said -

"Education is not the filling of a pail, but the lighting of a fire".

Beautiful quote. Thank you Julie.
Kay

messages.messageBody:
< "Free Knowledge
<
< Bring Your Own Container"
<
< any thoughts?

Have just been searching for a quote to sew onto a quilt I am doing about our home education year, and found the following:
Heraclitus said -

"Education is not the filling of a pail, but the lighting of a fire".

Julie in UK

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] poster at school
messages.msgSnippet: Well, I am a John Holt fan so I disagree with the container method myself.  Learning is experiential and this is why I have chosen to homeschool.  Alexander is
messages.messageBody:
Well, I am a John Holt fan so I disagree with the container method myself. Learning is experiential and this is why I have chosen to homeschool. Alexander is not a container. He is a beautiful human being. I think cultivating seeds and providing the opportunity for growth to happen is more attune to my philosophy. He is not an empty box. He came into this world with eyes wide open and ready to explore and discover. Where he goes I follow. He is a teacher to me. I am a facilitator and do my best to feed his desire to learn.
My .02, for what it is worth.
Kay
----- Original Message -----
From: moonwindstarsky
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, May 08, 2004 6:28 AM
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] poster at school


"Free Knowledge

Bring Your Own Container"

any thoughts?

it reminds me of what my mom said, "you don't have to figure
anything out, [just do what they tell you] get A's, and knowledge
should be pounded into your head - it's the only way you'll remember
something"
